answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some articles discussing districts that have entered into similar contracts. You may want to contact them directly for more information about their agreements.
Sandy Springs, GA and Johns Creek, GA partnered with a private corporation to establish a joint EMS program for the community.
http://icma.org/en/Article/101339/ChatComm_Better_Faster_Cheaper
The City Of Eau Claire, WI established partnership with private medical providers to improve their dispatch services.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302407/2010_ICMA_Community_Partnership_Award_Nominee_Regional_Emergency_Medical_Services_Program
Normandy Park, WA contracted out its police dispatching services.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4328/Focus_on_Process_Key_to_Successful_Service_Change
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Neal Beets
text: Does anyone have a relatively current contract for 9-1-1 dispatch services between a municipality and a private, quasi-private, quasi-public entity that they would be willing to share?   If so, please email to nbeets@windhamct.com.   I am the Town Manager for Windham, CT, and we are drafting a dispatch contract with a 501 (c) (3) entity, and want to see what others have done.  Of course, as soon as possible.  Thank you.
title: 9-1-1 Dispatch Contract
